Chapter 2 Data sources The following two data sets are both directly exported as CSV files from NYC Open Data. 2.1 NYC Crime Data It is a large data set which contains 35 columns and 7.38M rows. The problem with this data set lies in processing it ready for our analysis, since it might involve irrelevant information, missing values and unclear structure. The only problem with it is missing values. Link: https://data.cityofnewyork.us/Public-Safety/NYPD-Hate-Crimes/bqiq-cu78 Collected by: Rona Xu

Chapter 3 Data transformation 3.1 NYC Crime Data To begin with, we selected the data from Year 2020 for the further analysis. Then, we decided to remove irrelevant variables. Since this project is more focus on the victims perspective, we took out observations associated with the suspects information. What is more, we eliminated police abbreviations and codes to make this report reader-friendly. Finally, we converted the exact time of crime occurrence from the HH:MM:SS format to an interval value defining a period of time in hours, which aids in modeling. This cleaning process reduced the size of the original data set significantly and made analysis more efficient. 3.2 NYC Hate Crime Data For this relatively neat and small data set, we only took out a few features, including police terminology and arrest ID.
